text: Bigelowia nudata (pineland rayless goldenrod) is a species of North American flowering plant in the daisy family. It is native to the coastal plain of the southeastern United States (from eastern Louisiana to North Carolina).Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map Bigelowia nudata is a sub- shrub that grows up to 70 cm (28 inches) tall, often forming clumps. Most of the leaves are in a rosette near the ground, with smaller and narrower leaves on the stems. Flower heads are small, yellow, and displayed in flat-topped arrays, each with 2-6 disc florets but no ray florets. The plants generally grow in swamps and bogs.Flora of North America, Pineland rayless-goldenrod, Bigelowia nudata (Michx.) DC.Anderson, Loran Crittendon. 1970.
